summary.p: The Taṇṭalaiyār Catakam, also known as Paḻamoḻi Viḷakkam. This work is attributed to Cāntaliṅka Kavirāyar (Zvelebil 1995, p. 119, 536) and, alternatively, to Pātikkācup Pulavar (Zvelebil 1995, p. 535).
The Avaiyaṭakkam is found twice (U2, f[1]v and U3, f1v).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (May 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Blank except for shelfmark in black ink on recto.
1 folio = Taṇṭalaiyār Catakam: Invocation and Avaiyaṭakkam. No foliation.
57 folios = Taṇṭalaiyār Catakam: alternative Invocation, Avaiyaṭakkam again (same verse as in U2), and Text. Tamil foliation 1–57. The foliation of f2 consists in twice the figure 1, that is 1+1.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. Blank except for shelfmarks in black ink on verso.

layoutDesc.layout: Final letter(s) indented at the end of line.

additions.desc: N° 11 in black ink (f[1]r). This is the number in Velanguani Arokium's catalogue, first numbered list (f. 3r, no. 11).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to 1740 by Cabaton (1912), on unknown grounds. Not after 1833 as donated in that year by Reydellet.

provenance.p:
Most probably a manuscript owned by Reydellet as indicated by the shelfmark in black ink N° 11 (U1, f[1]r), which most probably refers to the number in Velanguani Arokium's catalogue (1845), first numbered list (f. 3r, no. 11).
See item 20 (Histoire de Tandelu) in Liste des manuscrits Tamouls donnés à la Bibliothèque du Roi par M. Reydelet (NAF 5441, f311v).

acquisition.p: Received, May 27th, 1833, from Reydellet (officier de marine en retraite au Havre). See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1, no. 43 (Histoire de Tandelu).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
